oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Fourth Liberty Loan volunteer pin
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This Fourth Liberty Loan Volunteeer pin belonged to Pvt. Henry E. Phillips. Phillips, who never saw combat, was from Oliver Springs, Tennessee. Liberty Bonds were sold by the US government as a way to raise funds for the allied war effort. Phillips, or someone in his family, apparently served as a volunteer seller of the bonds. Buying war bonds became a symbol of patriotisim during WWI.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
